summary: This bill, known as the COUNTER Act, aims to protect U.S. assets from unmanned aircraft system incursions. It amends Title 10 of the United States Code to clarify authority, protocols, and exemptions related to the Department of Defense's (DoD) and Coast Guard's activities in mitigating threats from unmanned aircraft systems. Key changes include delegating authority to commanders, defining terms, exempting certain information from disclosure, and broadening the scope of activities covered, including emergency response and assistance to other agencies. Additionally, it specifies timelines and reporting requirements.
